lines.text: Remember, with great power comes great responsibility.
[last lines]
"With great power comes great responsibility." This is my gift, my curse. Who am I? I'm Spider-man.
You don't trust anyone, that's your problem.
I trust my barber.

[lands in front of Spider-Man on a rooftop]
Wake up little spider, no you're not dead yet just paralysed. You're an amazing creature, Spider-Man. You and I are not so different.
I'm not like you. You're a murderer.

Well, to each his own. I chose my path, you chose the way of the hero. And they found you amusing for a while, the people of this city. But the one thing they love more than a hero is to see a hero fail, fall, die trying. In spite of everything you've done for them, eventually they will hate you. Why bother?
Because it's right.

[slaps Spider-Man on the head]
Here's the real truth. There are eight million people in this city. And those teeming masses exist for the sole purpose of lifting the few exceptional people onto their shoulders. You, me? We're exceptional.
[leans in and grabs Spider-Man's neck]

I could squash you like a bug right now, but I'm offering you a choice. Join me! Imagine what we could accomplish together... what we could create. Or we could destroy! Cause the deaths of countless innocents in selfish battle again and again and again until we're both dead! Is that what you want?
[jumps on the glider]
Think about it, hero!
Has he mentioned me?
Yeah.
What'd he say?
Uh... I said... he asked me what I thought about you.
And what did you say?

I said... uh... Spider-Man, I said uh... The great thing about MJ is... when you look in her eyes and she's looking back in yours... everything... feels... not quite normal. Because you feel stronger and weaker at the same time. You feel excited and at the same time, terrified. The truth is... you don't know what you feel except you know what kind of man you want to be. It's as if you've reached the unreachable and you weren't ready for it."
You said that?
Well, something like that.

[Harry walks in while they're holding hands]
Hi...
[trying to learn how to shoot a web]
Go web! Fly! Up, up, and away web! Shazaam! Go! Go! Go web go! Tally ho.
[first lines]

[voiceover]
Who am I? You sure you want to know? The story of my life is not for the faint of heart. If somebody said it was a happy little tale... if somebody told you I was just your average ordinary guy, not a care in the world... somebody lied.

[the Green Goblin has just pummeled Spider-Man]
Misery, Misery, Misery, that's what you've chosen. I offered you friendship and you spat in my face.
[Green Goblin continues to beat Spider-Man]

You've spun your last web, Spider-Man. If you had not been so selfish, your little girlfriend's death would have been quick and painless, but now that you've really pissed me off, I'm gonna finish her nice and slow. MJ and I, we're gonna have a hell of a time!

[Green Goblin lunges forward, but Spider-Man blocks and pushes him into a brick wall]
Peter, Peter, stop, it's me!

[Green Goblin takes off his mask, revealing Norman Osborn]
Mr. Osborn...
Oh, Peter, thank God for you...
You killed those people on that balcony!
The Goblin did it, I had nothing to do with it! Please, don't let him take me again! I beg of you, protect me!
You tried to kill Aunt May! You tried to kill Mary Jane!
But not you? I tried to stop it, I couldn't stop it.
[Norman pushes a button on his suit and the glider rises]
If anything happened to me, I knew it was you who would save me and so you have, Peter thank god for you

[Norman rises up]
Give me your hand, I've been like a father to you. Be a son to me now.
I had a father, his name was Ben Parker.
Godspeed, Spider-Man

[Warned by spider-sense, Spider-Man black flips over the oncoming glider]
Oh!
[the glider impales Norman]
Peter, don't tell Harry.
[singing]
The itsy bitsy spider climbed up the water spout. Down came the Goblin and took the spider out.
Not everyone is meant to make a difference. But for me, the choice to lead an ordinary life is no longer an option.

[after Peter lets an armed man escape with a bag full of cash]
You coulda taken that guy apart! Now he's gonna get away with *my* money!
I missed the part where that's my problem.
Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us...
[the Green Goblin bursts through the window]

[screams]
DELIVER US!

[laughing maniacally]
Finish it. FINISH IT!
FROM EVIL!
I want you to know, that I will always be there for you; I will always be there to take care of you. I promise you that. I will always be your friend.
Only a friend, Peter Parker?
That's all I have to give...
Can I do anything for you?
You do too much - college, a job, all this time with me... You're not Superman, you know.
[talking about Uncle Ben]
I can't help thinking about... the last thing I said to him. He tried to tell me something important, and I threw it in his face.
You loved him. And he loved you. He never doubted the man you'd grow into; how you were meant for great things. You won't disappoint him.
You're amazing.
Some people don't think so...
But you are.
Nice to have a fan...
[as New Yorkers battle the Green Goblin, who's attacking Spider-Man]
Leave Spider-Man alone! You're gonna pick on a guy trying to save a bunch of kids?
Yeah, I got something for your ass! You mess with Spidey, you mess with New York!
You mess with one of us, you mess with all of us.
[the Goblin crashes through the Daily Bugle office]

[grabbing Jameson by the throat]
Jameson you slime! Who's the photographer who takes pictures of Spider-Man?
I don't know who he is! His stuff comes in the mail!
YOU'RE LYING!
I swear!
He's the one who can take me to him!
I don't know who he is!

[preparing to punch Jameson]
You are useless you...!

[appears upside-down outside the window]
Settle down, tough guy.

[drops Jameson and turns around on the glider]
Speak of the Devil!
What's your name kid?
The Human Spider.
The Human Spider? That's it? That's the best you've got?
Yeah.
Oh that sucks.
Think you're pretty funny, don't you, freak?
Flash, it was just an accident!
My fist breaking your teeth, that's the accident.
C'mon, Flash, stop!
I don't want to fight you, Flash.
I wouldn't want to fight me, neither.
[in Aunt May's hospital room]
Go home dear, you look awful.
And you look beautiful...
I wanna... act. On stage.
Really? Well that's perfect. You were awesome in all the school plays.
Really?
Yeah. I cried like a baby when you played Cinderella.
Peter, that was first grade.
Well, even so...

[at a burning building, a cop approaches Spider-Man]
Hold it right here, you're under arrest! I'm taking you in!

[a scream is heard in the building]
There's somebody still up there!
I'm going.
I'll be here when you get back.
Not coming back, chief.
[in Aunt May's hospital room]

[relating to M.J. what he supposedly said to Spider-man]
I said, um, Spider-man, I said, uh, the great thing about M.J. is when you look in her eyes, and she's looking back in yours, everything feels not quite normal, because you feel stronger, and weaker at the same time. You feel excited, and at the same time, terrified. The truth is you don't know what you feel, except you know what kind of man you want to be. It's as if you've reached the unreachable, and you weren't ready for it.
You said that?
Oh, something like that...
[On the morning after Peter gets bitten]
Feeling better this morning? Any change?
Change? Yep. BIG change.
[after Mary Jane's audition]
So you just came by?
I was in the neighborhood...
Who are you?
You know who I am.
I do?
Your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man.
Mr. Jameson they are very important clients, they can't wait.
They're about to.
A hundred bucks? The ad said three thousand.
Well, check it again, web head. The ad said three grand, for three minutes, and you pinned him in two. For that I give you a hundred, and you're lucky to get that.
I need that money.
I missed the part where that's my problem.

[looking at spiders]
Disgusting!
Yeah, I hate the little things.
I love 'em.
Oh yeah, me too.
You know, you're taller than you look.
I hunch.
Don't.
[Peter is going to take a picture of Mary Jane]
Don't make me look ugly.
That's impossible.
What do you see coming for you?
I don't know. Whatever it is, it's something I never felt before.
And... what for me?
For you? You're gonna light up Broadway.
We've got a page six problem.
We've got a page one problem, shut up.
I've been like a father to you, be a son to me now.
I have a father, his name was Ben Parker.
[upon inspecting Peter Parker's bedroom]
A bit of a slob, isn't he?
All brilliant men are.
[as Flash Thompson tries to beat up Peter Parker in school]
Help him, Harry!
[one of Flash's buddies tries to tackle Peter from behind, Peter senses it and jumps, flipping over backward and landing on his feet]
Which one?
Spider-Man is all but invincible; but Parker, we can destroy him.
I can't.
Betrayal must not be countenanced. Parker must be educated.
What do I do?
Instruct him in the matters of loss and pain. Make him suffer, make him wish he were dead.
Yes?
And then grant his wish.
But how?
The cunning warrior attacks neither body nor mind.
TELL ME HOW!
The HEART Osborn! First, we attack his heart!

[about Peter's pictures of Spider-Man]
They're crap. Crap, crap, megacrap. I'll give you two hundred bucks for all of 'em.
[Norman hears the Green Goblin cackling]
Is somebody there?

[mocking]
Somebody?
Who are you?
Don't play the innocent with ME - you've known all along!
Where are you?
Follow the cold shiver running down your spine...
[Norman wildly searches among his collection of masks for the source of the voice]

[impatiently]
I'm right HERE!
[Norman turns and confronts his reflection in a mirror]
I, I don't understand...
Did you think it was coincidence - so many good things happening for you, all for you, Norman?
[He drains Norman's glass and hurls it away]
What do you want?
To say what you won't, to do what you can't - to *remove* those in your way...
[He holds up a newspaper which Norman examines. The main headlines state the murder of the Oscorp Board of Governors at the hands of the Green Goblin]
The Board Members - you killed them!
WE killed them!
We?
Remember? Your little "accident" in the laboratory...?
The performance enhancers...
power beyond your wildest dreams and its only the beginning. There is only one who could stop us - or imagine if he joined us...
[as Norman watches in fear, the Goblin bares his teeth in an utterly manic grin... ]
Spider-Man wasn't trying to attack the city, he was trying to save it. That's slander.
It is not. I resent that. Slander is spoken. In print, it's libel.
Sorry I'm late. Work was murder.
Hey, it's me again!
Hey!
How was your audition?
How'd you know?
The hotline. Your mom, told my aunt, told me.
So you just came by?
I was in the neighborhood, needed to see a friendly face. I took three buses and a cab to *get* in the neighborhood, but... So how'd it go?

[wryly]
Oh. They said I needed acting lessons. A *soap opera* told me I needed acting lessons.
Lemme buy you a cheeseburger. The sky's the limit, up to seven dollars... and eighty-four cents.

[laughs]
I'd like a cheeseburger. Oh, but I'm going out to dinner with Harry.
[pause]
Come with us.
No thanks. How's it going with...
[Mary Jane looks down]
Never mind, it's none of my business.
It's not? Why so interested?
I'm not.
You're not?
Well... Why would I be?

[playfully]
I dunno. Why would you be?

[smiles, not knowing what to say]
I dunno.
Sorry you won't come with us. I better run, Tiger.
You have a knack for getting in trouble.
You have a knack for saving my life. I think I have a superhero stalker.
I was in the neighborhood...
the end of one thing, the start of something new.
[first words]
Back to formula!
[he hurls Doctor Strong through glass and leaps after him, baring his teeth]

[hurling a pumpkin bomb at the Oscorp Board of Governors]
OUT, AM I?
[He quickly sends his glider over to Mary Jane]
Hello, my dear!
[MJ screams]
[Spider-Man takes Norman Osborn's body to his home and places him on his bed. Unfortunately, Harry discovers him... ]
What have you done? WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?
[He grabs a gun from a drawer, but finds Spider-Man gone... ]
[in Aunt May's hospital room, talking about Mary Jane]
Well, Harry's in love with her. She's still his girl.
Isn't that up to her?
She doesn't really know who I am.
Because you won't let her. You're so mysterious all the time. Tell me, would it be so dangerous to let Mary Jane know how much you care? Everybody else KNOWS...
Norman, the board is unanimous. We're announcing the sale after the World Unity Festival. I'm sorry.
You're out, Norman.
Am I?
He's saved my life twice and I've never even seen his face.
Hey freak show! You're going nowhere. I got you for three minutes. Three minutes of PLAYTIME!
He doesn't want to be famous? Then I'll make him infamous.
M.J. and I, we're gonna have a hell of a time.
Thanks for sticking up for me, Harry.
You heard?
Everyone heard that creep.
That creep is my father, all right! If I'm lucky, I'll become half of what he is. So just keep your mouth shut about stuff you don't understand!
Dresses like a spider, he looks like a bug, we should all just give him one big hug...
The one thing they love more than a hero is to see a hero fail.
Welcome to the Daily Bugle.
Thanks. I'm Peter Parker. I'm a photographer.
Yes, I can see that.

[Flash and his gang are hassling Peter]
Leave him alone.
Or what?
Or his father will fire your father!
[they laugh]
What's daddy gonna do, sue me?
What is going on? The next person who talks will fail this course, I kid you not.
I don't mean to lecture and I don't mean to preach. And I know I'm not your father...
Then stop pretending to be!
[Harry arrives at his home, but hears a strange cackling laugh]
Hello?
[Harry slowly walks up the stairs and rounds a corner]
Dad!

[rather befuddled]
Oh, hello, Harry...
[Harry turns to leave]
Harry... I just wanted to say how sorry I am that I haven't been much of a father to you.
It's okay. You're a busy man.
That's no excuse.
[he takes a slightly surprised and confused Harry in his arms and holds him for one long, precious moment]
Take care of yourself, son. Don't make the same mistake I did.

Spider-Man. This is why only fools are heroes - because you never know when some lunatic will come along with a sadistic choice. Let die the woman you love... or suffer the little children? Make your choice, Spider-Man, and see how a hero is rewarded!
Don't do it Goblin!
We are who we choose to be... now, *choose*!
[talking about the web-crawler]
He stinks and I don't like him.
Some spiders change colors to blend into their environment. It's a defense mechanism.
Peter, what possibly makes you think I would want to know that?
Who wouldn't?

[from trailer]
Who am I? Are you sure you want to know? If someone told you I was just your average ordinary guy without a care in the world, somebody lied. Truth is it wasn't always like this. There was a time when life was a lot less complicated.
If we can get a picture of Julia Roberts in a thong, we can certainly get a picture of this weirdo.
Can Spider-Man come out to play?
They're all beautiful, until they're snarling after your trust fund like a pack of ravening wolves.

[changing a light bulb]
And the Lord said, "Let there be light." And voilà! There is light. Forty soft, glowing watts of it.
Good boy. God will be thrilled, just don't fall on your ass.
[to J. Jonah Jameson]
Hey, kiddo. Let Mom and Dad talk for a minute, will ya?
Had you not been so selfish, your little girlfriend's death would have been quick and painless, but now that you've really pissed me off, I'm gonna finish her nice and slow.
Hoffman, run down to the patent office, copyright the name "Green Goblin." I want a quarter every time someone says it.
How about "Green Meanie"?
Bonesaw is READY!
Who is Spider-Man? He's a criminal that's who he is! A vigilante! A public menace! What's he doing on MY front page?

[describing a headline]
"Spider-Man, Hero or Menace? Exclusive Daily Bugle Photos".
Menace? He was protecting that armored truck...
Tell you what Atticus, you take the pictures, I'll make up the headlines! Ok? Is that ok with you?
Yes sir.
Goody.
Can I take your picture for the school paper?
Sure.
In this lab we have fifteen genetically enhanced super spiders.
There's fourteen. One's missing.
This guy, Flash Thompson, he probably deserved what happened. But just because you can beat him up doesn't give you the right to. Remember, with great power comes great responsibility.
What're ya doin' up there?
Staying away from you. That's a cute outfit. Did your husband give it to you?
What do you want?
To say what you won't, to do what you can't, to remove those in your way.
We'll meet again, Spider-Man!
Peter, look. You're changing. I know. I went through exactly the same thing at your age.
No. Not exactly.
One day Spider-Man will pay. I swear on my father's grave Spider-Man will pay.
[talking about Spider-Man]
Guy with eight hands. Sounds hot.
No matter what I do, no matter how hard I try, the ones I love will always be the ones who pay.
[returning for Thanksgiving dinner]
Sorry I'm late, it's a jungle out there; I had to beat an old lady with a stick to get these cranberries.

You know, you were about six years old when Mary Jane's family moved in next door. And when she got out of the car, and you saw her for the first time, you grabbed me and you said, "Aunt May, Aunt May, is that an angel?"
Gee, did I really say that?
We sold out four printings.
Sold out?
Every copy.
Tomorrow morning, Spider-man page one, with a decent picture this time...
[as Peter Parker confronts the carjacker who just murdered Uncle Ben]
Don't hurt me, just give me a chance, just give me a chance...
What about my uncle? Did you give *him* a chance?
[shouts]
Did you? Answer me!
I am going to rectify certain inequities.
Peter, are you alright?
I'm fine.
Peter, I'd like to introduce you to my father, Norman Osborn.
It's an honor to meet you, Sir.
What the hell was that?
Godspeed, Spider-Man.

[as he is dying]
Peter? Don't tell Harry.
Do I get to say thank you this time?
Follow the cold shiver running down your spine.
You've spun your last web, Spider-Man.

[to Spider-Man]
You and I are not so different.
I'm not like you. You're a murderer.
Well... to each his own.
You won't have a bite?
No thanks. Had a bite.
You know Harry... doesn't live on a little place I like to call Earth.
I better run, tiger.

No jobs! Freelance! Best thing in the world for a kid your age. You bring me some more pictures of that newspaper-selling clown, maybe I'll take 'em off your hands. But I never said you have a job. *Meat*. I'll send you a nice box of Christmas meat. It's the best I can do - get out of here.
A word to the "not-so-wise" about your little girlfriend. Do what you need to with her, then broom her fast.

[referring to the Green Goblin]
Whatever it is, somebody has to stop it...
How was your audition?
How did you know?
Hotline... your mom, told my aunt, told me...
Let me buy you a cheese-burger - sky's the limit, up to seven dollars and eighty-four cents.
Forty thousand years of evolution and we've barely even tapped the vastness of human potential.
I can't... tell you... everything; I mean, there's so much to tell...
[In the burning building]
You're pathetically predictable, like a moth to the flame. What about my generous proposal? Are you in or are you out?
It's you who's out, Gobbie. Out of your mind.
Wrong answer.
Mr. Osborn!
Peter! Thank God for you!
You killed those people on that balcony.
The Goblin killed them! I had nothing to do with it!
You tried to kill Aunt May. You tried to kill Mary Jane.
But not you.
They said I need acting lessons. Can you believe that? A soap opera told me I need acting lessons.
Where do you go all the time?
Around...
I offered you friendship, and you spat in my face.

[to Peter]
Harry tells me you're quite the science whiz. You know, I'm something of a scientist myself.

[talking to M.J]
I was in the neighborhood. I needed to see a friendly face. I took two buses and a cab to get in the neighborhood, but...
[Peter breaks a lamp in his room trying to practice his web shots]
[Behind door]
Peter?
[Peter opens door barely to hide webs in his room]
What's - what's going on in there?
I'm excercising. I'm not dressed Aunt May.
Well... you're acting so strangely Peter...
Ok... thanks.
